721609f-a.text:
Marble Hill Ave, south from Kingsbridge to 228th Street, showing
Spuyten Duyvil Creek in the foreground.
March 28, 1906.
Brown Brothers.
721609f-a.folder: Marble Hill Avenue & 228th Street, Manhattan, NY

721608f.folder: Marble Hill Avenue & 228th Street (West), Manhattan, NY

715835f-a.text:
West 228th Street, south side, east from and including Marble Hill Ave., showing at the S.E. corner of same St. Stephens M.E. Church. In the background appears the elevated structure of the west side I.R.T. subway on Broadway. Buildings, faintly outlined across same are in the Borough of the Bronx. The 2 1/2 story frame house seen on the right is No. 96 Marble Hill Ave.

P.L. Sperr                    October 26, 1927
